meta.content: Digg, pictures, technology, breaking news, entertainment, politics, headline news, celebrity news, offbeat, world business, sports, funny videos

div.div: REMINDER: DON'T GO TO THIS SITE

div.a: This Is Probably The Site Behind The Recent Tech Company Hacks

div.div: Apple, Facebook, Twitter — all hacked. And it's probably the fault of just one site.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UEFnsC&via=Digg&text=This Is Probably The Site Behind The Recent Tech Company Hacks

div.div: IN CASE OF EMERGENCY, CHECK YOUR INBOX

div.a: The Facebook Feature That Accidentally Alerted A Mother To Her Son's Death

div.div: Anna Lamb-Creasey's son had disappeared without a trace. She called hospitals and jails. She waited for days and then weeks and then a month, desparate for a sign of life. She posted to his Facebook page. "Rickie where are you? Love mom." Rickie was dead.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YED4T6&via=Digg&text=The Facebook Feature That Accidentally Alerted A Mother To Her Son's Death

div.a: Hostage For A Day

div.div: How I became a human bargaining chip.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yx6VOx&via=Digg&text=Hostage For A Day

div.div: SIGN ONE: YOU DON'T OWN ONE

div.a: 7 Signs PlayStation Vita Is a Disaster

div.div: In late 2011, Sony launched a new handheld platform called PlayStation Vita, the successor to its PSP. But instead of improving on PSP’s performance, Vita’s first year has been much worse.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13aTdCc&via=Digg&text=7 Signs PlayStation Vita Is a Disaster

div.div: TO BE FAIR, NOT THE CRAZIEST WWII IDEA

div.a: Winston Churchill's Plan To Fight Nazis With Massive Aircraft Carriers Made From Ice

div.div: As 1942 began, Allied shipping was incredibly vulnerable to German U-boat attack. So Winston Churchill approved Operation Habakkuk: The plan to create a fleet of massive aircraft carriers made from ice.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zpm9Ki&via=Digg&text=Winston Churchill's Plan To Fight Nazis With Massive Aircraft Carriers Made From Ice

div.a: These Bonsai Fish Are Bred To Be Square

div.div: Artist Revital Cohen was once very interested in the laboratory rats genetically designed to be depressed. His latest documentary project 'Kingyo Kingdom' explores the centuries-old Japanese culture of breeding exotic, domestic Ranchu goldfish to look wrong from above.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yy4N9b&via=Digg&text=These Bonsai Fish Are Bred To Be Square

div.a: The Geography Of Happiness According To 10 Million Tweets

div.div: The happiest city in America is Napa, California -- and the saddest all swear too much.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yx9XlS&via=Digg&text=The Geography Of Happiness According To 10 Million Tweets

div.a: Joe Biden: Buy A Shotgun, Not An AR-15

div.div: "You don't need an AR-15 — it's harder to aim, it's harder to use. Buy a shotgun, buy a shotgun!"

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11Tzvjx&via=Digg&text=Joe Biden: Buy A Shotgun, Not An AR-15

div.div: HE COULD ALWAYS TRY BASEBALL AGAIN

div.a: Michael Jordan Has Not Left The Building

div.div: As he turns 50, MJ is wondering if there are any more asses to kick.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UmMaXN&via=Digg&text=Michael Jordan Has Not Left The Building

div.a: Using SimCity To Diagnose My Hometown's Traffic Problem

div.div: One man decided to take a crack at testing some theories that I have about my own hometown of Northenden, Manchester (population of roughly 15,000, as far as I can tell) based on SimCity.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y2jm6N&via=Digg&text=Using SimCity To Diagnose My Hometown's Traffic Problem

div.div: CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF METEORS

div.a: Do Meteor Showers Ever Run Out Of Meteors?

div.div: Yes, but it takes a long, long time.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y2NWLO&via=Digg&text=Do Meteor Showers Ever Run Out Of Meteors?

div.a: The Mind-Controlled Bionic Hand That Also Controls Your Mind

div.div: This week, a team of Swiss researchers announced that it will begin testing a new “sensing” bionic hand, one which looks to explore our ideas about the relationship between brain and machine. Now, it is the robots’ turn to speak.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VG45KQ&via=Digg&text=The Mind-Controlled Bionic Hand That Also Controls Your Mind

div.a: The New United States Of Booze

div.div: Nearly a century after prohibition, the alcohol industry is turning a new corner on U.S. soil, and it is responding to American calls for variety, choice, and transparency.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yx8OL7&via=Digg&text=The New United States Of Booze

div.a: A Queer History Of Computing

div.div: There are many ways of telling the history of universal computation, and many origins of the technologies we now consider computational machines. Most every history would certainly include the contributions of Alan Turing, an openly gay man who was convicted of Gross Indecency, made to undergo chemical castration, and ultimately committed suicide in June of 1954.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YE9GfH&via=Digg&text=A Queer History Of Computing

div.a: Photos Of Snowflakes, Because They're Pretty

div.div: Photographer Alexey Kljatov shoots incredibly beautiful photographs of snowflakes on the open balcony of his home using a custom compact camera kit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3ouYv&via=Digg&text=Photos Of Snowflakes, Because They're Pretty

div.a: The World's Most Expensive Starbucks Drink

div.div: This is the world's most expensive Starbucks drink. It's just as terrifying as you think.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/1324pFL&via=Digg&text=The World's Most Expensive Starbucks Drink

div.a: How Film Trailers Are Made

div.div: How scenes from five of the nine Best Picture nominees were reassembled to promote the films.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZphvMh&via=Digg&text=How Film Trailers Are Made

div.a: Are Container Ships Getting Too Big?

div.div: The world's cargo ships are getting big, really big. No surprise, perhaps, given the volume of goods produced in Asia and consumed in Europe and the US. But are these giant symbols of the world's trade imbalance growing beyond all reason?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/135JtJr&via=Digg&text=Are Container Ships Getting Too Big?

div.a: The Science Of Yeti Footprints

div.div: We're at last getting into spring, which means that whatever abominable prints that yetis have left in the snow this year will be melting away into nothing. Possibly, though, they'll be melting into existence before they return to nonexistence. Here's how a little melt can make a yeti track that could fool anyone.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/139JsV3&via=Digg&text=The Science Of Yeti Footprints

div.div: WHEN DOES HE DO ASTRONAUT STUFF?

div.a: Commander Chris Hadfield Teaches You How To Cook In Space

div.div: The world's most social media savvy astronaut shows us his "kitchen" and prepares a zero-g treat.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xrqvwh&via=Digg&text=Commander Chris Hadfield Teaches You How To Cook In Space

div.a: We Are One Step Closer To Condom Vending Machines In Taxis

div.div: Last year, the New York City Economic Development Council gave a local business school student a $17,500 grant to fund what was basically the best idea ever: Miniature vending machines, sized to fit snugly in the backseat of a taxi, ready to dispense items that New Yorkers on the go really need.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12Iu9Hg&via=Digg&text=We Are One Step Closer To Condom Vending Machines In Taxis

div.a: Will The Next 'Call Of Duty' Be On Facebook?

div.div: In 2013, the social network wants gamers playing more than just "FarmVille."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3zEfQ&via=Digg&text=Will The Next 'Call Of Duty' Be On Facebook?

div.a: William Shatner Now Just Arguing With People On Reddit

div.div: "So this is what you are afraid of? An actor not wanting to answer your horse/duck questions and wanting to promote their movie? ;-)"

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W8kz9j&via=Digg&text=William Shatner Now Just Arguing With People On Reddit

div.div: GETS WEIRD WHEN HE RUNS INTO ACID BURN

div.a: Fascinating Video Tracks A Real Chinese Hacker In Action

div.div: Here's a video that purports to show one of the Chinese hackers in the act of attacking real, unsuspecting “English language” targets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y604vG&via=Digg&text=Fascinating Video Tracks A Real Chinese Hacker In Action

div.a: The Massive Russian Meteor By The Numbers

div.div: The big space rock that crashed into the Ural Mountains last week was the largest in a century, and worth more than its weight in gold.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YwT9vg&via=Digg&text=The Massive Russian Meteor By The Numbers

div.a: What Happens When You Shoot Infectious Diseases Into Space

div.div: Scientists shot Salmonella into space, and the virus came back three to seven times more virulent.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VrGH1e&via=Digg&text=What Happens When You Shoot Infectious Diseases Into Space

div.a: Oscar Pistorious Tells His Side Of The Story

div.div: Oscar Pistorius returned to court today, where for the first time the Paralympic champion publicly offered his version of how he ended up shooting and killing his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XishB5&via=Digg&text=Oscar Pistorious Tells His Side Of The Story

div.div: INNOCENT UNTIL TWITTER SAYS HE'S GUILTY

div.a: The Burger King And Jeep Hacker Is Probably This DJ From New England

div.div: Is a criminal mastermind behind the @BurgerKing (and likely @Jeep) takeover? Nope—just a guy who plays shows in Rhode Island who left an unfortunate Internet paper trail.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WUQFt7&via=Digg&text=The Burger King And Jeep Hacker Is Probably This DJ From New England

div.a: How To Tie A Bow Tie In GIFs

div.div: In case you've been wondering, here's how to tie a bow tie

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y2MhrD&via=Digg&text=How To Tie A Bow Tie In GIFs

div.a: The Most Terrifying Drone Video Yet

div.div: An Air Force simulation says researchers are at work on killer robots so tiny that a group of them could blend into a cityscape.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/1310QQ1&via=Digg&text=The Most Terrifying Drone Video Yet

div.a: Russian Meteor's Sonic Boom Shatters Windows During Karate Class

div.div: These kids were pretty calm considering there was a gigantic flash of light outside.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12H6NSv&via=Digg&text=Russian Meteor's Sonic Boom Shatters Windows During Karate Class

div.a: Half-Naked Ivy League Prof Opens Quantum Physics Course With 9/11 Footage, Hitler

div.div: There is no (definitive) manual on How to Teach Quantum Physics, obviously, but one imagines that if such a manual existed it would likely recommend against opening your first lecture half-naked, curled into a fetal position while footage of Hitler, Saddam Hussein, and 9/11 play on the projector.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZnpZ6K&via=Digg&text=Half-Naked Ivy League Prof Opens Quantum Physics Course With 9/11 Footage, Hitler

div.div: EXTINCTION AT THE SPEED OF LIGHT

div.a: A Catastrophic Little Bubble Of 'Alternate Universe' Will End Up Killing Us All At The Speed Of Light

div.div: Scientists are still sorting out the details of last year's discovery of the Higgs boson particle, but add up the numbers and it's not looking good for the future of the universe, they report.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12F1oet&via=Digg&text=A Catastrophic Little Bubble Of 'Alternate Universe' Will End Up Killing Us All At The Speed Of Light

div.a: What Happens When You're Stoned During Your Driving Test

div.div: CNN may have just posted their best piece of investigative journalism in years. In the following video, three drivers of varying ages got incredibly high on marijuana and test-drove cars around a course.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XnGxYa&via=Digg&text=What Happens When You're Stoned During Your Driving Test
